intro: Leucosyke villosa, commonly known as the hairy leucosyke, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Leucosyke villosa thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested or shaded habitats.
